alert.note: Alert for Berks; Lehigh; Lower Bucks; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 3:46AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN MORRIS...HUNTERDON... SOUTHWESTERN WARREN...NORTHWESTERN MERCER...SOMERSET...NORTHWESTERN MIDDLESEX...NORTHEASTERN BERKS...LEHIGH...NORTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY... NORTHWESTERN BUCKS AND SOUTHERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 344 AM EST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from near Morristown to near Lebanon to near Bloomsbury to near Allentown to New Tripoli. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. Wind gusts over 30 mph are possible with this squall, with snow reducing visibility to around one mile. Locations impacted include... Allentown, New Brunswick, Easton, Morristown, Somerville, Somerset, Bethlehem, Bridgewater, Middlesex, Emmaus, Bound Brook, Manville, Northampton, Quakertown, Perkasie, Byram, Wilson, Bedminster, Hellertown and Morris Plains. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 37 and 65. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 43 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 42. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 3 and 35. Use caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Quick changes in visibility and slick roads can lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Berks; Lehigh; Lower Bucks; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery
